item.title: Al Qaeda’s African Offshoot Makes a Lethal Comeback
item.description: Only a few years after French troops scattered its fighters, Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb has regrouped and extended its reach in three nations.
item.category: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
item.dc:creator: DIONNE SEARCEY, ERIC SCHMITT and RUKMINI CALLIMACHI
item.media:description: French forces in January near a hotel in Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso, occupied by militants from Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb.

item.title: Myanmar Lawmakers Name Htin Kyaw President, Affirming Civilian Rule
item.description: U Htin Kyaw, a confidant of Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, was considered almost certain to take the presidency after his nomination last week by her party.
item.dc:creator: WAI MOE and AUSTIN RAMZY
item.media:description: Htin Kyaw, center, won with more than half the votes in Parliament.

item.title: Editorial: Putin’s Syria Surprise
item.description: A military pullback announced by Russia’s leader could be a signal that he is serious about a lasting peace.
item.dc:creator: THE EDITORIAL BOARD
item.media:description: Vladimir Putin, right, meeting in Moscow on Monday.

item.title: Editorial: Congress Should Allocate Money to Fight Zika
item.description: Delaying dedicated emergency funds could put thousands of people at risk.
item.category: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
item.dc:creator: THE EDITORIAL BOARD
item.media:description: The mosquito that transmits the Zika virus at a lab in San Juan, P.R.

item.title: First Russian Jets Leave Syria After Putin’s Withdrawal Order
item.description: Forces at an air base near Latakia began loading equipment and making other technical preparations necessary to start the pullout.
item.dc:creator: NEIL MacFARQUHAR

item.title: Omar the Chechen, an ISIS Official Wounded by U.S. Raid, Has Died
item.description: The militant, Omar al-Shishani, was the Islamic State’s minister of war, according to the Pentagon.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: ERIC SCHMITT and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT

item.title: Finalists Picked for New Prize Created in Memory of Armenian Genocide
item.description: The Aurora Prize for Awakening Humanity is meant to honor those whose exceptional work to preserve human life in disasters created by humans puts them in great peril.
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
item.dc:creator: RICK GLADSTONE

item.title: North Korea Threatens Nuclear Test, Defying U.N.
item.description: Kim Jong-un said his country would soon conduct another nuclear test and also flight-test ballistic missiles capable of carrying a nuclear warhead.
item.dc:creator: CHOE SANG-HUN

item.title: World Briefing: France: A Restaurant Begins Again
item.description: La Petit Cambodge, one of the Paris sites attacked by terrorists last November, reopened on Monday night.
item.dc:creator: YANNICK SLADE CAFFAREL

item.title: Boston Journal: As More Immigrants Arrive, Some Britons Want to Show Them and E.U. the Door
item.description: Their presence has caused anxiety and resentment in Boston, a town in northeast England that has come to epitomize the country’s rising antagonism toward immigration.
item.dc:creator: KIMIKO DE FREYTAS-TAMURA
item.media:credit: Andrew Testa for The New York Times
item.media:description: Workers harvested vegetables this month in the fields around Boston, in northeast England.

item.title: Putin Orders Start of Syria Withdrawal, Saying Goals Are Achieved
item.description: The order from the Kremlin came as the United Nations was trying to revive peace talks to stop the conflict, which has created a humanitarian catastrophe.
item.dc:creator: NEIL MacFARQUHAR and ANNE BARNARD
item.media:description: Russian pilots climbing into a fighter jet at the Hemeimeem air base in Syria in October.

item.title: Amid ISIS Battles, American Surrenders in Iraq
item.description: The American man left Virginia to fight for the Islamic State and was caught near the northern city of Sinjar, Kurdish and U.S. officials said.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: KAMIL KAKOL and NICHOLAS FANDOS
item.media:description: A photograph on social media shows a man the Kurdish military says is an American who turned himself in on Monday.

item.title: News Analysis: Is the U.S. Now at War With the Shabab? Not Exactly
item.description: Last week’s airstrike against a training camp in Somalia shows how the executive branch has stretched a 2001 congressional authorization for military force originally aimed at Al Qaeda.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.dc:creator: CHARLIE SAVAGE
item.media:description: Shabab fighters in 2011. An airstrike on a Shabab camp last week in Somalia killed about 150.

item.title: World Briefing: Venezuela: 4 Bodies Found in Case of 21 Gold Miners Missing in Jungle
item.description: Investigators have found the remains of four people presumed to be gold miners missing more than a week in Venezuela’s southern jungle.
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: World Briefing: Nigeria: Huge Methamphetamine Lab Built With Mexican Help, Officials Say
item.description: Nigerian officials arrested four Mexicans who were accused of creating a lab capable of producing billions of dollars’ worth of methamphetamine.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Turkey ‘Almost Certain’ that Kurdish Militants Bombed Ankara, Premier Says
item.description: The government’s blaming the Kurdistan Workers’ Party, or P.K.K., could raise tensions between Turkey and the United States, who are allies in Syria.
item.dc:creator: CEYLAN YEGINSU and TIM ARANGO
item.media:description: A Turkish forensic team on Monday investigates the site of deadly bombing in Ankara, the Turkish capital, which killed 37 people on Sunday.

item.title: News Analysis: German State Elections Point to Vulnerability for Angela Merkel
item.description: In giving a far-right party up to a quarter of the vote, Germans let their chancellor know they are not happy with how the refugee crisis is being handled.
item.category: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
item.dc:creator: ALISON SMALE

item.title: European Union Suspends Aid to Burundi Over Political Crisis
item.description: Officials announced a halt in financial support over a political crisis that has claimed hundreds of lives, but said humanitarian aid would continue.
item.dc:creator: SEWELL CHAN

item.title: Defying E.U., Hundreds of Migrants Enter Macedonia From Greece
item.description: Migrants formed a human chain to cross a river; at least three drowned. It was unclear whether they will be sent back to Greece.
item.category: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
item.dc:creator: ALEKSANDAR DIMISHKOVSKI
item.media:description: Migrants crossed a river on Monday while trying to find a way over the Greek-Macedonian border.

item.title: In Late Antiquity Textiles, a Long-Lasting Fashion Show
item.description: On display in New York, fabrics that somehow survived time’s decay reflect the wealth and social standing of the elite in the late Roman Empire.
item.category: Institute for the Study of the Ancient World
item.dc:creator: JOHN NOBLE WILFORD
